page.title: 05Village shops
page.content: The villages of Brinsley and Underwood are not well equipped with shops.The majority of people visit nearby towns for their weekly food shopping,notably Eastwood and Kimberley.The newly built Sainsburys in Kimberly is particularly popular. Tere are a handful of small stores in the villages which provide groceries, newspapers,drinks etc. There are two post offices in Brinsley,which is a spread-out village,and one in Underwood. A most welcome addition to the facilities in Brinsley is a take away Fish and chip shop. Apart from the general stores there are no shops which specialize in particular goods.These are found in Eastwood two miles away and which is joined by a frequent bus service.
